data_structures.py¶

contains the Params class and subclasses, which are pretty basic

they have attributes for every field in the data files, e.g. mfdp.dat files have a field for Z, so a MFDPParams object has an attribute .Z

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.CedarBatchParams(**kwargs)¶
class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.DefaultParams(**kwargs)¶
class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.LocalBatchParams(**kwargs)¶
class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.MFDPParams(**kwargs)¶
class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.ManParams(**kwargs)¶
class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.Params(filetype, **kwargs)¶

I created this rather than just using dictionaries or something for parameter passing, because with dicts, I tend to lose track of which variables every file type needs, etc.

When you create a Params object, it makes sure that all variables are provided, and that no extra ones are provided!

param_dict()¶

returns a dict with the same info contained in the Params object

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.SummitBatchParams(**kwargs)¶
